Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    The main simulator class. Handles the entire VANET simulation.
    Author:
    sriram

      Method called by the RPR algorithm to generate vehicles and change speeds and generate packets for vehicles.

      Helps vehicles deliver packets to other vehicles and RSUs.

      A method called only by the RPR algorithm, meant for toggling RSUs as in toggleRSU().
      private static void _transmitPackets(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist, java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist)
      Method called by RPR algorithm.
      private static void changeVelocity()
      Changes the velocity of vehicles in vehlist by making use of each vehicle's timer, and samples a new velocity from an exponential distribution once the countdown reaches zero.
      private static boolean checkNbhdIdle(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist, Vehicle v)
      Checks of the num_hops hop neighbourhood of a vehicle v is tx-free, by checking if there is any tx at the neighbouring RSUs.
      private static boolean delPktID(java.util.Queue<Packet> queue, int id)
      Deletes a packet with the given id in the passed packet queue
      static double generateExp(double lambda)
      Generates a random double sampled from an exponential distribution with parameter lambda.
      private static void generatePackets()
      Generates packets for all vehicles in vehlist by sampling an exponential distribution.
      private static void generateVehicles()
      Generates new vehicles, updates positions of old vehicles, checks for boundary conditions, decides if to loop them (fixed_cars) or to let them exit the grid.
      private static Vehicle getByID(java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist, int id)
      Returns the object with the given id in the passed list of vehicles.
      static double[] getStats(RSU u, java.util.ArrayList<RSU> Uprime)
      Takes the RSU under consideration by the RPR algorithm, u, and the RSUs to be installed, Uprime, and computes PDR, Energy and Grid fraction.

      Generates a 2D grid of RSUs

      The main function.

      Plots the arrival distribution of vehicles.

      Plots the avg segment density per km

      A single interation of the RPR algorithm that the original paper talks about.

      Function that handles the reception (of currently broadcast packets in a segment) by both RSUs and vehicles.

        No. of timesteps in an episode

        static int rpr_no_timesteps
        No. of timesteps in an episode (RPR simulation)

        static int no_episodes
        No. of episodes

        static int rpr_no_episodes
        No. of episodes (RPR simulation)

      • road_len_x

        static int road_len_x
        Length of the road in the X direction, in meters.

      • segment_len_x

        static int segment_len_x
        Length of a segment in the X direction, in meters.

      • road_len_y

        static int road_len_y
        Length of the road in the Y direction, in meters. Setting road_len_y = segment_len_y ensures there is only one L-R road

      • segment_len_y

        static int segment_len_y
        Length of a segment in the Y direction, in meters.

      • pkt_size

        static int pkt_size
        Size of a packet in bytes

      • num_hops

        static int num_hops
        Number of hops to check for idleness. No. of hops to check for hidden terminals.

      • cw_min

        static int cw_min
        Contention window lower bound.

      • cw_max

        static int cw_max
        Contention window upper bound.

      • max_ttl

        static int max_ttl
        Max time to live before pkt is dropped

      • vert_traffic

        static boolean vert_traffic
        True turns on traffic in the Y direction as well

      • max_battery

        static double max_battery
        Maximum battery capacity, in Whr.

      • timeslot_len

        static int timeslot_len
        Length of a timeslot, in terms of number of timesteps. Used to keep track of number of packets delivered in a timeslot.

      • rx_pow

        static int rx_pow
        Radio power during reception, in J

      • res_pow

        static int res_pow
        Radio power during idle state, in J

      • bandwidth

        static double bandwidth
        Bandwidth, in Mbps

      • battery_profile

        static int battery_profile
        Battery profile in Whr. Change this for different times of the day

      • delta_e_switch

        static int delta_e_switch
        Switching energy, in J

      • battery_delta

        static int battery_delta
        Minimum battery value, in Whr

      • grid_cost

        static double grid_cost
        Grid energy cost in $ per kWhr

      • solar_cost

        static double solar_cost
        Solar energy cost in $ per KWhr

      • min_pdr

        static double[] min_pdr
        An array to store minimum PDR values (used by RPR). Each element is used in a different episode, so that trends can be observed if different values are given.

      • fixed_cars

        static boolean fixed_cars
        A boolean to set if cars are to be a fixed number (true), or to be sampled (false).

      • uniform

        static boolean uniform
        Setting this to true selects all RSUs, giving a uniform distribution. False enables RPR.

      • fixed_cars_no

        static int fixed_cars_no
        Number of fixed cars to generate, if fixed_cars is true. Unused if false.

      • pdr_fixedcars

        static boolean pdr_fixedcars
        A commandline mode that when set true accepts a single parameter, the fixed no. of cars, and prints a single value, the average PDR. Useful to plot number of vehicles vs PDR.

      • inc_min_pdr

        static boolean inc_min_pdr
        Increment the minimum PDR after each episode if true.

      • init_min_pdr

        static double init_min_pdr
        Initial minimum PDR to use

      • step_min_pdr

        static double step_min_pdr
        Step by which to increase the minimum PDR, after every episode.

      • lambda_vehicle

        static double lambda_vehicle
        Parameter for the exponential sampling vehicles

      • lambda_velocity

        static double lambda_velocity
        Parameter for the exponential sampling velocity

      • lambda_pkt

        static double lambda_pkt
        Parameter for the exponential sampling Packets

      • lambda_countdown

        static double lambda_countdown
        Parameter for the exponential sampling the countdown timer of the vehicles

      • trackPkt

        static boolean trackPkt
        Set to true if packets are to be tracked through the simulation. Displays data if true.

      • trackVehicle

        static boolean trackVehicle
        Set to true if vehicles are to be tracked through the simulation. Displays data if true.

      • trackRSU

        static boolean trackRSU
        Set to true if RSUs are to be tracked through the simulation. Displays data if true.

      • printTimestep

        static boolean printTimestep
        Print a separator indicating the beginning of a new timestep, if true.

      • printEpisode

        static boolean printEpisode
        Print a separator indicating the beginning of a new episode, if true.

      • finalStats

        static boolean finalStats
        Print final statistics collected after every episode, as well as average statistics

      • printAvgPDR

        static boolean printAvgPDR
        Print only average PDR in a separate line. Set to true automatically if pdr_fixedcars is true.

      • printData

        static boolean printData
        Print vehicle arrival distribution and avg. segment density distribution details. Useful if plots are to be generated external to the program.

      • genGraphs

        static boolean genGraphs
        Plot vehicle distribution and avg. segment density distribution.

        static java.util.Random rand
        The random variable generator

        public Simulator()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function. If pdr_fixedcars is true, the fixed no of cars can be passed as an argument, and will print the average pdr. If pdr_fixedcars is false, doesn't take any parameter. Print booleans can be modified to change displayed output.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • receivePackets

        private static void receivePackets()
        Function that handles the reception (of currently broadcast packets in a segment) by both RSUs and vehicles.

      • getByID

        private static Vehicle getByID(java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist,
              int id)
        Returns the object with the given id in the passed list of vehicles.
        Parameters:
        vehlist - the list of vehicles
        id - id of the vehicle to be found
        Returns:
        null or Vehicle object

      • delPktID

        private static boolean delPktID(java.util.Queue<Packet> queue,
               int id)
        Deletes a packet with the given id in the passed packet queue
        Parameters:
        queue - the packet queue of a vehicle
        id - the packet to be deleted
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating success/failure of the delete task

      • toggleRSU

        private static void toggleRSU(java.util.ArrayList<RSU> Uprime)
        Turns RSUs on if there is at least one vehicle in the corresponding segment. Else turns them off. Also updates energy stats, battery status, whether an RSU is using solar power or grid power. The passed parameter Uprime is the set of 'installed' RSUs; any RSU not in this list is permanently turned off.
        Parameters:
        Uprime - The list of installed RSUs

      • plotGraphs

        private static void plotGraphs()
        Plots the arrival distribution of vehicles.

      • plotSegdist

        private static void plotSegdist()
        Plots the avg segment density per km

      • resetSimulator

        private static void resetSimulator()
        Resets all variables after every episode

      • initSimulator

        private static void initSimulator()
        Generates a 2D grid of RSUs

      • transmitPackets

        private static void transmitPackets()
        Handles the transmission of packets from vehicles. Drops packets whose delay bound is reached. Checks if backoff counter is zero, if no tx in 3 hop neighbourhood and if no tx at current node, and then whether to tx or backoff.

      • checkNbhdIdle

        private static boolean checkNbhdIdle(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist,
                    Vehicle v)
        Checks of the num_hops hop neighbourhood of a vehicle v is tx-free, by checking if there is any tx at the neighbouring RSUs.
        Parameters:
        rsulist - the list of RSUs
        v - The vehicle whose neighbourhood is to be checked
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the neighbourhood of vehicle v is idle or not.

      • generateExp

        public static double generateExp(double lambda)
        Generates a random double sampled from an exponential distribution with parameter lambda. Performs inverse transform sampling.
        Parameters:
        lambda -
        Returns:
        A random number sampled from the exponential distribution

      • generateVehicles

        private static void generateVehicles()
        Generates new vehicles, updates positions of old vehicles, checks for boundary conditions, decides if to loop them (fixed_cars) or to let them exit the grid.

      • generatePackets

        private static void generatePackets()
        Generates packets for all vehicles in vehlist by sampling an exponential distribution.

      • changeVelocity

        private static void changeVelocity()
        Changes the velocity of vehicles in vehlist by making use of each vehicle's timer, and samples a new velocity from an exponential distribution once the countdown reaches zero.

      • _toggleRSU

        private static double[] _toggleRSU(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist,
                  int[][] num_delivered,
                  RSU u,
                  java.util.ArrayList<RSU> Uprime)
        A method called only by the RPR algorithm, meant for toggling RSUs as in toggleRSU(). rsulist is the list of RSUs that are available, num_delivered keeps track of the number of packets delivered in a time slot, u is the new RSU being considered (if to add to Uprime, the list of RSUs that are to be installed). Functioning is same as toggleRSU() mostly.
        Parameters:
        rsulist - the list of RSUs generated for the RPR simulation
        num_delivered - number of pkts delivered in the current timeslot
        u - the RSU under consideration
        Uprime - the RSUs already chosen
        Returns:
        Returns fraction of grid energy consumed and the energy consumed by RSU u as an array

      • _generateVehicles

        private static int _generateVehicles(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist,
                    RSU u)
        Method called by the RPR algorithm to generate vehicles and change speeds and generate packets for vehicles. Vehicles are generated along a 1D road only. rsulist is the entire list of RSUs, vehlist is the list of vehicles and u is the RSU under consideration currently in the RPR algorithm. Functioning is same as generateVehicles, generatePackets() and changeVelocity() mostly.
        Parameters:
        rsulist - the list of RSUs generated for the RPR simulation
        vehlist - the list of vehicles generated for the RPR simulation
        u - the RSU under consideration
        Returns:
        Number of packets generated

      • _transmitPackets

        private static void _transmitPackets(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist)
        Method called by RPR algorithm. Helps transmit packets from vehicles. Parameters are the entire list of RSUs, rsulist and the list of vehicles, vehlist. Functioning is same as transmitPackets() mostly.
        Parameters:
        rsulist - the list of RSUs generated for the RPR simulation
        vehlist - the list of vehilces generated for the RPR simulation

      • _receivePackets

        private static int _receivePackets(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<RSU>> rsulist,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> vehlist,
                  int[][] num_delivered,
                  RSU u)
        Helps vehicles deliver packets to other vehicles and RSUs. Used by the RPR algorithm. Parameters are the RSU list rsulist, and the list of vehicles, vehlist, the number of pkts delivered in the current time slot and the RSU under consideration, u. Functioning is same as receivePackets() mostly.
        Parameters:
        rsulist - the list of RSUs generated for the RPR simulation
        vehlist - the list of vehilces generated for the RPR simulation
        num_delivered - number of packets delivered in the current time slot
        u - the RSU under consideration
        Returns:
        The number of pkts received

      • getStats

        public static double[] getStats(RSU u,
                java.util.ArrayList<RSU> Uprime)
        Takes the RSU under consideration by the RPR algorithm, u, and the RSUs to be installed, Uprime, and computes PDR, Energy and Grid fraction.
        Parameters:
        u - the RSU being considered
        Uprime - the RSUs already chosen
        Returns:
        PDR, Energy and Grid Fraction values for RSU u.

      • RPR

        private static java.util.ArrayList<RSU> RPR(java.util.ArrayList<RSU> U,
                           double min_pdr)
        The modified RPR algorithm, implemented according to Vageesh's thesis. Takes the set of RSUs U, and the min_pdr required.
        Parameters:
        U - set of RSUs
        min_pdr - minimum PDR required
        Returns:
        The final list of RSUs that need to be installed.

      • Rainbow_product_ranking

        private static RSU Rainbow_product_ranking(java.util.ArrayList<RSU> S,
                          java.util.ArrayList<double[]> M)
        A single interation of the RPR algorithm that the original paper talks about. Called by Vageesh's algorithm. Takes a list of RSUs S and their features M, to build a skyline and suggest a single RSU to pick based on the best features.
        Parameters:
        S - a list of RSUs
        M - the features of the RSUs
        Returns:
        The best candidate discovered by the RPR algorithm
